posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
G'day All,

I was searching the ECB Guild Filter v2 and noticed there is no Bard/Fighter/CoT build?

I thought something like a Bard 24 / Fighter 6 / CoT 10 would be an interesting choice because:

1. Easy stat spread, can leave DEX and WIS low to pump CHA and STR;
2. Fighter provides heavy armour and weapon focus, weapon specialisation at normal and epic levels;
3. CoT providers extra feats allowing the easy allocation of Curse Song and Extra Music;
4. CoT provides extra universal saves and synergises with a high CHA score for Divine Wrath, Smite Evil and Lay on Hands.

Am I missing something here? Or do other combinations just do the above better?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Bard/Figh/CoT isn't a bad idea, it's just that other classes have better synergy with melee bards. CoT10 gives 5 feats, +5 universal saves (which counts towards the saves cap), and Divine Wrath (which is powerful but has a short duration). Smite Evil isn't really powerful enough to be a factor for this build. If you do make one then Bard26/Figh4/CoT10 is a better level layout than Bard24/Figh6/CoT10.

The four main classes melee bards take are BG, Figh, PM, and RDD. BG gives Divine Might, Divine Shield, and Dark Blessing (which doesn't count towards the saves cap), Figh gives more feats, PM gives the usual immunities, RDD gives both ability increases and several immunities.

Compare a Bard26/Figh4/CoT10 to a Bard20/BG4/PM16, Bard24/Figh6/PM10, Bard24/Figh6/RDD10, Bard26/BG4/PM10 or Bard26/BG4/RDD10. The Bard/Figh/CoT has more feats than any of the other builds, but it lacks immunities and divine feats that the other class combinatons have. Again, that doesn't mean that it's a bad idea, just that there are other builds that usually work better.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi SnorriHT

This is what I would play, based on what you tell me about your environment (dev crit being disabled)
You can tweak it to whatever you would like
I like my bards to be difficult to kill with the d6 hit die of the class. It makes them one less liability to worry about in parties.
Here this guy is only not a liability, he can tank implosions and death magic for the party with 400+hp and a fort save of 37(44).
I also put spot up nice and high. This is because I find spot more useful than listen, in general.
Listen is good for detecting enemies through walls and around corners, and helps with invisible enemies (although I find I have to stand next to them to detect them with listen). Unfortunately it gets worse with distance, which the value of detection is to detect them before they detect you. 
Spot allows detection of enemies from a distance as long as they are in eyesight, and also prevents sneak attacks from stealth, which listen does not.

You will notice I put lingering song and lasting inspiration into the build, this is because it takes a while to get to lasting inspiration despite me rushing it
Improved Disarm is an excellent feat for a bard with curse song (lowering your opponents AC and discipline) and high strength wielding a two handed. It is really fun to use and one can drop some saves feats for this. 
Ie drop strong soul and great fortitude for disarm/improved disarm.

Taunt is also good, I think you wanted dual detect but you might have to make some compromises and take 43 points out of listen spot or spellcraft to get taunt as well, but I felt with a base AB of 41 + bard/curse song (effective +7AB/7AC) it could be overkill for your environment

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Smite Evil/Good adds physical damage, not divine damage. Divine Might and Divine Wrath both give unblockable divine damage that bypasses both DI and DR. With CoT10 you get +10 physical damage from Smite Evil and +5 unblockable divine damage from Divine Wrath.

On your build Orion2019 you go for a Bard12/Figh4/CoT4 pre-epic spread, which I think is best, but finish at Bard24/Figh6/CoT10 rather than Bard26/Figh4/CoT10. You can take EWS on a CoT level so you can switch to Bard26/Figh4/CoT10 for an improved Bard Song. Both builds have the same number of feats but Bard26/Figh4/CoT10 has a better Bard Song, although it requires rearranging your feat progression and it will need Perform boosting items to unlock a level 25 Bard Song.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, if one has both, one can switch up between the two and none, as one wishes.

It's one of the unique forms of combat modes that allows this - one can select none, +5 AC or +10 (assuming one has taken both feats).

So it is pretty flexible.  Imagine one can taunt a foe, hit the expertise for the +5 AC and still have a positive AB as a Bard.  Hit that Song, Curse, and then Taunt, and then go Impr. Expertise.  It's like wooohoooo! Next level stuff!

Note that it will not work with ranged weapons.
